title: Deb Fischer
added: Prior to the [[2020 United States Electoral College count]] scheduled for January 6, 2021, Fischer announced that she would vote to certify the election results.<ref>{{cite news |title='I will uphold my oath': Nebraska Sen. Deb Fischer says widespread voter fraud not proven in 2020 election |url=https://www.ketv.com/article/i-will-uphold-my-oath-nebraska-sen-deb-fischer-says-widespread-voter-fraud-not-proved-in-2020-election/35132772 |access-date=14 January 2021 |work=KETV |date=5 January 2021 |language=en}}</ref> Fischer was on Capitol Hill to participate in the Electoral College count when Trump supporters [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|stormed the U.S. Capitol]]. During the attack, Fischer tweeted that “These rioters have no constitutional right to harm law enforcement and storm our Capitol. We are a nation of laws, not some [[banana republic]]. This must end now.”<ref>{{cite news |title='This must end now': Nebraska Sen. Deb Fischer condemns 'rioters' storming US Capitol |url=https://www.ketv.com/article/this-must-end-now-nebraska-sen-deb-fischer-condemns-rioters-storming-us-capitol/35142494 |access-date=14 January 2021 |work=KETV |date=6 January 2021 |language=en}}</ref>
